GapFillDragDrop.Title: must/might/can't have
GapFillDragDrop.Instruction: Click on the correct word or phrase and drag it to the correct gap.

Content.Question:
1 They don't have passports. They can't have left the country.
2 Jason must have won the lottery because he has just bought a million dollar house in Bermuda.
3 I can't find the dictionary â€“ I may have left it at home.
4 She didn't answer my phone calls; I know she had her mobile with her so she must have switched it off.
5 Our guests are very late and they don't have a map; they might have gone the wrong way.
6 I think I may have forgotten to lock the back door before I left for work.
7 She couldn't have been at the party; she was in hospital at the time.
8 He can't have phoned her because he doesn't have her phone number.
9 They can't have gone swimming, the pool is closed for repairs.
10 The caretaker must have opened the door, he has a full set of keys.
